individual_records.phenotype_details: experienced syncope and diagnosed with long QT syndrome
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 experienced syncope at age 12 and was diagnosed with long QT syndrome at age 13.

individual_records.phenotype_details: diagnosed with long QT syndrome after cardiac event
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P2 was diagnosed with long QT syndrome after a cardiac event at age 21.

individual_records.phenotype_details: no symptoms but carries the variant
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P3 carries the variant but has not shown any symptoms of long QT syndrome.

functional_data.summary: The KCNH2 variant p.Lys450Arg alters the biophysical properties of the IKr current.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in affected family members.
variants.additional_notes: The penetrance data suggests a significant risk of developing long QT syndrome among carriers.
key_quotes: The KCNH2 variant p.Lys450Arg alters the biophysical properties of the IKr current.
Patient P1 experienced syncope at age 12 and was diagnosed with long QT syndrome at age 13.
